In U-19 cricketers‚Äô journey to WC final, meet those who laid ground for them
Chelsea all at sea: Ponderous Pochettino, misfiring stars despite ¬£1 billion in transfers and clueless American owner
CLICK HERE FOR MORE
Haris‚Äôs Peshawar Zalmi will take on Shaheen Shah Afridi‚Äôs Lahore Qalandars at 7.30 pm tonight (Sunday) at the Gaddafi stadium in Lahore. 
In the past, Haris was asked who his favourite batsman was. ‚ÄúJos Buttler.‚Äù The interviewer followed up: ‚ÄòDo you want to be like him?‚Äù He replied with a stern face: ‚ÄúI want to be myself. I don‚Äôt want to be like someone, because I consider myself as the best.‚Äù He often tweets with the hashtag #BeTheBest.‚ÄúI value fearlessness and consider it to be a central trait of my personality. This is what my parents have taught me,‚Äù he would explain.

headlines: Samsung BKC is a playground to experience Galaxy AI, says Southwest Asia CEO
description: At Samsung BKC, customers can experience and learn more about Samsung products by just scanning QR codes.
content:
Samsung on Tuesday unveiled its brand new retail store at Jio World Plaza in Bandra Kurla Complex, Mumbai. At the inauguration, JB Park, President and CEO Samsung Southwest Asia said, ‚ÄúWith Samsung BKC, we are not only expanding our retail presence in India, we are putting together a playground to bring AI experiences to one place.‚Äù
The recently launched Galaxy S24 series will be available for pre-order from the Samsung BKC store starting today, where users will also be able to order online-exclusive colour variants of the Galaxy 24 Ultra at the venue.

headlines: To spur India‚Äôs energy transition, US to work on funding platform: Yellen
description: The inspection of Bengaluru-based Think & Learn Pvt Ltd, which operates under the brand BYJU'S, will be carried out by the ministry, which is implementing the companies law.
content:
The corporate affairs ministry has ordered an inspection of the books of BYJU‚ÄôS, a senior government official said on Monday amid the edtech major facing multiple headwinds, including delay in submitting financial statements and concerns over corporate governance issues.
The inspection of Bengaluru-based Think & Learn Pvt Ltd, which operates under the brand BYJU‚ÄôS, will be carried out by the ministry, which is implementing the companies law.
The ministry decided to carry out the inspection after taking note of the developments, including that the company has been unable to finalise its financial statements and that its auditor has resigned, the official told PTI.
ADVERTISEMENT
Also Read | Byju‚Äôs appoints ex-upGrad chief Arjun Mohan as CEO for international business
Earlier this month, the ministry asked the office of the Regional Director in Hyderabad to conduct an inspection of the company, which is registered in Bengaluru, the official said. The official also said that further course of action will be decided after receiving the inspection report.
A query sent to BYJU‚ÄôS seeking comments on the inspection remained unanswered.
Think & Learn Pvt Ltd was incorporated on November 30, 2011. The last Annual General Meeting of the company was held on September 19, 2022, as per data available with the ministry.
In recent months, the edtech major has been grappling with multiple issues, including concerns over its corporate governance practices.
ADVERTISEMENT
Audit firm Deloitte resigned as an auditor of BYJU‚ÄôS citing a delay in submitting financial statements while also simultaneously three of its board members resigned which indicated the deepening of the crisis at the edtech firm. Deloitte Haskins & Sells, which was slated to audit BYJU‚ÄôS until 2025, stepped down with ‚Äúimmediate effect‚Äù mid-term stating that ‚Äúthe financial statements of the company are long delayed.‚Äù
Also Read | Teacher and aspiring civil servant who was sacked by Byju‚Äôs shares his ordeal in the aftermath
Last month, sources aware of the development said BYJU‚ÄôS has committed to its investor to close the long-pending audit of the financial year 2022 by September and fiscal year 2023 by December.
In a call with shareholders last month, BYJU‚ÄôS CEO Byju Raveendran admitted his past mistakes and assured shareholders that his learnings far outweigh any missteps.
ADVERTISEMENT
Last week, the company said former SBI chief Rajnish Kumar and IT industry veteran T V Mohandas Pai will join its Advisory Council.

headlines: Sensex slumps 551 pts, Nifty falls to 19,671; Bajaj Finance top laggard after Q2 results
description: Only Tata Motors, Sun Pharma, Maruti Suzuki, and M&M closed in the positive territory in the 30-share Sensex pack. Bajaj duo - Bajaj Finance and Bajaj Finance - were the top laggards.
content:
Domestic equities plunged on Wednesday as oil prices jumped amid intensifying conflict in West Asia. BSE benchmark Sensex fell 551.07 points, or 0.83 per cent to 65,877.02, while broader NSE Nifty 50 slipped 140.40 points, or 0.71 per cent to 19,671.10.
Only Tata Motors, Sun Pharma, Maruti Suzuki, and M&M closed in the positive territory in the 30-share Sensex pack. Bajaj duo ‚Äì Bajaj Finance and Bajaj Finance ‚Äì were the top laggards.

headlines: Google‚Äôs new policy to delete inactive accounts sparks backlash
description: Google is deleting accounts that have not been used for two years, and it's not sitting well with users.
content:
Google has been sending out emails to its users, reminding them that starting from December 2023, it will begin deleting accounts that have been inactive for more than two years. The move has sparked backlash from some users who fear losing their data or access to services like YouTube.
Google said the new policy is intended to improve security and prevent attackers from taking over abandoned accounts. However, according to a CNBC report, some users are not convinced by this explanation and have criticised Google for being unclear, aggressive, and disingenuous.

content:

Perry died at the age of 54 on October 30 at his Pacific Palisades home here. The actor, who had detailed his life-long struggle with alcohol and drug addiction in his 2022 memoir, was found unresponsive in his hot tub and was believed to have drowned.

headlines: GSEB Gujarat announces changes in SSC, HSC board exam pattern
description: Gujarat state board exams 2024: Class 10 students will now be able to appear for supplementary exams in three subjects.
content:
Following a meeting chaired by the Gujarat Chief Minister Bhupendra Patel and attended by education minister Kuber Dindor among other senior officials, the state government on Thursday announced changes in Class 10 and 12 state board exams from academic session 2023-24.
The changes in the Class 10 and Class 12 exam pattern have been introduced keeping in mind the National Education Policy 2020. The major modifications announced by the Gujarat board include an increase of 10 per cent ‚Äî from 20 to 30 per cent ‚Äî in objective questions and in descriptive questions, the weightage being declined from 30 to 20 per cent.

headlines: MPC meeting: RBI leaves repo rate unchanged at 6.5%
description: Unveiling the bi-monthly monetary policy review, Reserve Bank of India (RBI) Governor Shaktikanta Das said the domestic economy exhibits resilience on the back of strong demand.
content:
IN LINE with market expectations, the Reserve Bank of India‚Äôs (RBI) Monetary Policy Committee (MPC) left its key interest rate unchanged for the fourth time in a row on Friday, even as it flagged retail inflation as a ‚Äúmajor risk to macroeconomic stability and sustainable growth‚Äù.
The RBI‚Äôs decision to keep the repo rate ‚Äî the rate at which the RBI lends money to banks to meet their short-term funding needs ‚Äî unchanged at 6.5 per cent will mean that all external  benchmark lending rates (EBLR) linked to the repo rate will not rise. It will provide relief to borrowers as their equated monthly instalments (EMIs) will not increase.

headlines: Jawan VFX breakdown video reveals Shah Rukh Khan‚Äôs computer-generated cigar, how the epic highway chase was created
description: Fans of Jawan were very impressed with the visual effects that went into creating the film. Red Chillies VFX revealed of its secrets behind the digital magic tricks witnessed in the Shah Rukh Khan-starrer.
content:
Red Chillies VFX has shared a video breakdown of the visual effects work that went into last year‚Äôs biggest Indian film, the Shah Rukh Khan-starrer Jawan. Directed by Atlee, the vigilante action film went on to gross over Rs 1100 crore globally, emerging as the most successful film of SRK‚Äôs career. Jawan told the story of a vigilante police officer who leads a team of female prisoners in carrying out socially conscious heists. Along the way, he reunites with his father, also played by SRK.
The three-minute VFX breakdown provides insight into several key moments from the film, revealing that the exterior of the metro train in the opening sequence was entirely computer-generated. The prison where a lot of the film‚Äôs action takes place was partially constructed, but enhanced through visual effects. The cottage where Vikram Rathore lived with his wife, played by Deepika Padukone, was created entirely with the help of visual effects. One of the most interesting details revealed in the breakdown video is that the cigar that Vikram smokes in the film was computer-generated, at least in the one shot shown in the video.

headlines: Ben Stokes named ICC Men‚Äôs Test Cricketer of the Year 2022
description: Stokes scored 870 runs at an average of 36.25 and picked 26 wickets at an average of 31.19 apart from leading England to nine wins across 10 Tests.
content:
England captain Ben Stokes has been named as the International Cricket Council (ICC) Men‚Äôs Test Cricketer of the Year for 2022.
The 31-year-old, who captained England to 9 wins off 10 Tests in the year, was pivotal to the team‚Äôs success with the bat as well as ball. He scored 870 runs at an average of 36.25, while also picking 26 wickets at an average of 31.19.
Stokes took over as England captain after a dismal start to the year for the red ball side and under his captaincy and with Brendon McCullum as the Test coach, England took to a more aggressive and going for the win approach in Tests, coined after the latter as ‚ÄòBazball‚Äô.
Leading from the front üåü
England‚Äôs inspirational captain is the recipient of the ICC Men‚Äôs Test Cricketer of the Year 2022 Award üèÖ#ICCAwards
‚Äî ICC (@ICC) January 26, 2023
Under his regime, England thrashed New Zealand and South Africa at home, hammered India in a one-off Test in Southampton before travelling to Pakistan and winning the three-match series.
England‚Äôs scoring rate of 4.13 across 15 Tests in 2022 was the second highest in history and the most since Australia in 1910. Those stats include the away defeat to West Indies and the end of the Ashes loss under Joe Root. In the matches in which Stokes led England, the team struck at a game-changing 4.77 per over.
Stokes was also named captain of the 2022 ICC Men‚Äôs Test Team of the Year.

headlines: IGNOU July 2023 fresh admission registration deadline extended till Oct 20
description: IGNOU July 2023 Admission: Candidates can apply for the July 2023 programmes at the official IGNOU website -- ignouadmission.samarth.edu.in.
content:
The Indira Gandhi National Open University (IGNOU) today extended the last date to apply for fresh admission against the July 2023 academic year. Students intending to apply in the July 2023 session will now get another 10 days to register for the IGNOU July 2023 programmes. The last date to register is October 20. Candidates can apply for the July 2023 admission process at the official IGNOU website ‚Äî ignouadmission.samarth.edu.in.
The open university has extended the application deadline for all online distance learning and online mode programmes except for the certificate programmes run by IGNOU.
The last date for "Fresh Admission  for all programmes offered in ODL/Online mode except certificate programmes for the July 2023 session has been extended again  till 20th October 2023.
ODL & Online mode Portals-https://t.co/AfynrKsivAhttps://t.co/bv54hWtEV8
‚Äî IGNOU (@OfficialIGNOU) October 11, 2023
IGNOU fresh admission form 2023: How to fill 
Step 1: Visit the official website ‚Äì ignou.ac.in
Step 2: Click on ‚ÄòRegister Online‚Äô followed by ‚ÄòFresh Admissions‚Äô
Step 3: Click on the ‚ÄòNew Registrations‚Äô tab
Step 4: Fill in all the required registration details
Step 5: Set a ‚ÄòUsername‚Äô and ‚ÄòPassword‚Äô
Step 6: Fill all the required information and submit
Step 7: With the login details received on the email ID and phone number, login using the same and fill in all the details required
Step 8: Select the programme to be studied
Step 9: Submit the IGNOU registration form
IGNOU has also extended the last date for re-registration of all programmes offered in the ODL and online mode  for the July 2023 session till October 20 with the payment of a late fee of Rs 200.

headlines: Qualcomm announces its first ‚Äòconsole-first‚Äô Snapdragon G series processors
description: The new Snapdragon G series processors are meant for fanless handheld gaming consoles.
content:
Qualcomm unveils its first set of chips designed for fanless handheld gaming consoles. Currently, the series has a total of three processors ‚Äî Snapdragon G1 Gen 1, Snapdragon G2 Gen 1, and the Snapdragon G3x Gen 2, the most powerful of the lot.
The Snapdragon G1 Gen 1 is an entry-level processor with an octa-core Kryo CPU cluster along with an Adreno A11 graphics chip. This processor comes with an integrated network modem with support for Wi-Fi 5, and Bluetooth 5, and can support a 1080p display at 60fps.

headlines: Saturn will lose its rings. Long before that, they will turn invisible to us
description: Saturn is set to lose its characteristic rings but that will take a long time as far as humans are concerned. But in 2023, those very rings could become invisible to us.
content:
The National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA) in 2018 confirmed that Saturn is losing its rings at a rapid pace. The planet‚Äôs gravity is pulling in enough ice from the rings to fill an Olympic-sized swimming pool in half an hour. Even though it will take a long time for the rings to disappear completely, they are soon going to be invisible to us here on Earth.
An optical illusion
Galileo was the first person to observe Saturn‚Äôs beautiful rings in 1610 when he turned his 20x telescope towards the planet named after the Roman god of agriculture. Right now, anyone with basic astronomy gear can turn their equipment towards the planet to catch a glimpse of the rings that are made of billions of small chunks of ice and rock.

headlines: ‚ÄòNot out of form‚Ä¶cannot judge him on the basis of a few innings‚Äô: Shaheen Shah Afridi lauds Babar Azam‚Äôs batting after 3rd NZ vs PAK T20I
description: New Zealand vs Pakistan: In three games, Babar has made 181 runs at an average of 60.33 in the current T20I series compared to 126 runs from six innings he could manage at an average of 21 in Australia in Tests
content:
New Zealand thrashed Pakistan by 45 runs on Wednesday in the third T20I in Dunedin. Chasing 225 runs, Pakistan kept losing wickets at regular intervals. While the side‚Äôs talisman, Babar Azam, piled up his third consecutive half-century of the series, he could not receive support from the other end for the visitors to have a chance.
With the defeat, Pakistan lost the five-match series; however, Babar has had a productive series after a barren Test series against Australia.‚ÄùI had said it earlier as well that Babar was not out of form. We cannot judge him on the basis of a few innings,‚Äù skipper Shaheen Shah Afridi lauded the former skipper.

The US Mission in India has issued over 90,000 study visas this Summer, i.e. in June, July, and August.

headlines: A couple of holes in my shoes with few legs sticking in, says Neil Wagner about team huddle after New Zealand beat England by 1 run
description: Left-arm fast bowler took four crucial wickets - Ollie Pope, Joe Root, Ben Stokes, and last man James Anderson just when the second Test seemed to be slipping away from New Zealand's grasp
content:
NZ vs ENG: As the delirious with joy New Zealand players ran and jumped over each other before forming a huddle to celebrate the famous one-run win over England in Wellington, fast bowler Neil Wagner was the hero of the moment. Four wickets, including that of Ollie Pope, Ben Stokes, Joe Root and last man James Anderson, were priceless and he was also quick on the field taking two smart catches.
‚ÄúSomeone‚Äôs nail fish-hook in my face‚Ä¶ a couple of holes in my shoes with few legs sticking in ‚Ä¶ these are the moments that stay with life forever ‚Äì not 5 wickets or whatever,‚Äù Wagner said when asked about the celebrations within the huddle.
New Zealand, after being made to follow-on, had posted 483 and gave England a 258-run target.
For all his effort with the ball, Wagner came very close to handing England the win.
New Zealand‚Äôs Neil Wagner, left, and teammate Matt Henry embrace after New Zealand won by 1 run on day 5 of their cricket test match against England in Wellington, New Zealand, Tuesday, Feb 28, 2023. (Andrew Cornaga/Photosport via AP)
In what was to be the second last ball of the second Test, left-arm quick Wagner bowled short down the leg-side to last man James Anderson. England, riding high on their Bazball philosophy, needed two to win at that point. If the ball had been called a ‚Äòwide‚Äô the scores would have been tied. But it was not to be and the second Test at Wellington hung in the balance.
Four overs earlier it was Wagner who took a tumbling catch at fine leg to dismiss the last recognised batsman Ben Foakes who had skied his pull shot to Tim Southee. But Anderson and Jack Leach had survived and England were just a couple of runs away from sweeping the two match series 0-2. Anderson had even swung to find a four in Wagner‚Äôs previous over.
But Wagner would have the last laugh. His hard lengths and deceptively good short balls are always a handful. Here he was really steaming in and bending his back to get the ball to rise. The ball to dismiss Anderson wasn‚Äôt the best though. Short and once again more leg-side, the England fast bowler could have let it go. But Anderson‚Äôs feeble attempt to play it to fine leg as the ball was rising towards his hips ended up in the hands of diving wicketkeeper Tom Blundell. A little more bat on it and the ball would have headed to the boundary. But New Zealand had pulled off a famous win; the first time a team following on had won a Test since India‚Äôs famous win over Australia at Eden Gardens.
WHAT A GAME OF CRICKET
New Zealand have won it by the barest of margins‚Ä¶
This is test cricket at its finest ‚ù§Ô∏è
#NZvENG pic.twitter.com/cFgtFBIkR4
‚Äî Cricket on BT Sport (@btsportcricket) February 28, 2023
‚ÄúToo much went through my head. Gosh! All the things that go at the top of the mark. What ball to bowl, they needed 2 runs. Should I pitch it and be at his stumps? You just stick to your guns. Keep thinking about getting that glove or catches in play. It just came off. Great character from the team to keep fighting,‚Äù Wagner said after pulling off the tense win.
ADVERTISEMENT
It was Wagner who also struck major blows during England‚Äôs run chase when he dismissed the well-set Joe Root for 95 after getting rid of England captain Ben Stokes. Root was surprised by the rising trajectory of the ball and was caught at mid-wicket, Stokes tried to dispatch Wagner to the boundary but was caught too.
‚ÄúIt‚Äôs about summing up the conditions . There is a period where you go at him, take risks, and see if you can do this (bouncing at Stokes) ‚Äì and buy a wicket. They needed runs, they also know they can get out. When you get wickets, it makes it hard for the next guy to start. It‚Äôs about summing up the conditions,‚Äù Wagner said about dismissing Stokes and Root in successive overs. Stokes and Root had added 121 runs for the sixth wicket and till they were at the crease, England looked in control.
When Anderson had hit a welcome boundary off Wagner in the 73rd over with England needing just six to win, it looked like this could be another win for the Bazball brand of cricket. Wagner said he felt the game had slipped away at that point.
‚ÄúI thought that was the game. I was going for his gloves and the last thing I expected him to do was backing away and getting a big hit at it. And going between Williamson‚Äôs legs is not something you see. Especially in the over prior, one edge flew over Blundell (the wicketkeeper). You start thinking, whether that‚Äôs it, is this the game?.‚Äù
ADVERTISEMENT
Kane Williamson who made a back against the ball century when they were following on called it a ‚Äòfantastic game‚Äô.
‚ÄúDoesn‚Äôt quite feel right to be standing here, after a game of cricket like that and the contributions we‚Äôve seen from both teams throughout. A fantastic game of cricket to be a part of and, for us as a team, we‚Äôve been fighting away in the test format for a while so it‚Äôs nice to get across the line on this one. This England team is playing incredible cricket at the moment and we‚Äôre up against it, coming into this game. So to fight away and compete and ultimately just get across the line is a really nice feeling,‚Äù Williamson said.
"We keep living to fight for one another"
The man of the moment Neil Wagner reflects on The Black Caps' historic win over England‚Ä¶#NZvENG pic.twitter.com/GkJr04yW5u
‚Äî Cricket on BT Sport (@btsportcricket) February 28, 2023
England skipper Stokes said that he and Root should have taken the team home.
‚ÄúThat game is what Test cricket is about, the emotions we were going through and the Kiwi boys as well. Everyone‚Äôs got their money‚Äôs worth today. We knew that at some point Tim would have to roll the dice. For Joe and myself, that was the opportunity to pounce, and sometimes things don‚Äôt happen how you want them to. With bouncer plans, you have to make a decision about what to go to. As soon as Waggie came on I saw it as an opportunity to take 20 runs.‚Äù

headlines: SA vs IND: Aiden Markram leaves self-doubts behind for counter-attacking century
description: Choosing his end to attack, never dropping the bat below the waist, South African opener plays with assured footwork to score memorable 106 off 103 balls on devilish track.
content:
There are two Aiden Markrams out there. India has usually brought out the vulnerable one. The fragile version had the ‚Äúbiggest relief‚Äù, according to his long-time mentor Pierre de Bruyn, when Dean Elgar and then Temba Bavuma were made Test captains. It was against India when Markram, just 23 and playing just his third ODI, was made the captain in a ODI series in 2018 and the ‚Äúnext Graeme Smith‚Äù collapsed under pressure. In a series where India crushed South Africa 5-1, Markram was so distressed that he didn‚Äôt even remember the manner of his dismissal in the final ODI at Port Elizabeth in his post-game chat with an alarmed de Bruyn. A year later, during another nightmarish series in India, after he got out to twin ducks in the Pune Test, he punched a ‚Äúsolid object‚Äù in the dressing room and left the tour with a fractured wrist. He would soon be dropped from the team.
‚ÄúWhat we saw in Pune was as a build-up, a ticking time bomb,‚Äù de Bruyn had told this newspaper. ‚ÄúIt was a frustrating tour for him, and the whole captaincy thing that was placed on his shoulders before‚Ä¶ That is not Aiden, to go into a change room and hit the cupboard. When that incident happened, I was worried.‚Äù

headlines: BSEB 2024 Matric Exam: Class 10 Bihar Board exam form out; registration open till September 17
description: The secondary.biharboardonline.com website has made the Class 10th BSEB 2024 exam forms available.
content:
The Class 10 matric exam application form for Bihar School Examination Board (BSEB) is out for 2024 exams. Students in Class 10 can apply through their respective school heads. The last date to submit the BSEB 10th exam 2024 application form is September 17.
The heads of schools will have to download the Class 10 exam form 2024 application form from the secondary.biharboardonline.com website and make the registration form available for the students for the 2024 matric exams. The students will then have to fill out the 2024 matric exam application form and submit it to the school heads.

headlines: ‚ÄòJust because MS Dhoni came and won a World Cup as soon as he took charge, doesn‚Äôt mean it‚Äôll happen to everyone‚Äô: Ravichandran Ashwin
description: Speaking on his YouTube channel, Ashwin also urged the Indian fans to be patient with Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli on accounts of the national team's trophy drought.
content:
India all-rounder Ravichandran Ashwin has shared his views on India‚Äôs lack of an ICC trophy since 2013 and stated that just because former India captain Mahendra Singh Dhoni led the team to a World Cup win in his first attempt as a captain doesn‚Äôt mean it can be assumed the same for others that have followed or come before.
‚ÄúIt‚Äôs easy to say you haven‚Äôt won this and so on. After the 1983 World Cup, the great Sachin Tendulkar played the 1992, 1996, 1999, 2003, and 2007 World Cups. He finally won the World Cup in 2011. He had to wait for 6 World Cups to finally win one,‚Äù Ashwin said on his YouTube channel. ‚ÄúJust because another stalwart MS Dhoni came and won a World Cup as soon as he took charge, doesn‚Äôt mean it‚Äôll happen to everyone, right?‚Äù

headlines: ‚ÄòI don‚Äôt think you can come and replicate what they do. Nathan Lyon is not R Ashwin‚Äô: Ian Chappell
description: Ashwin and Jadeja have picked a total of 31 wickets between them in the first two Tests and together share 130 scalps against Australia in the 10 Tests.
content:
Former Australia captain turned broadcaster Ian Chappell believes the Australian spinners shouldn‚Äôt try and replicate the Indian spin duo of Ravichandran Ashwin and Ravindra Jadeja, despite their methods being extremely successful early in the four match series.
‚ÄúToo often they (opposition spinners) do try and replicate the skillset (of Ashwin and Jadeja). Talking about Ashwin and Jadeja‚Ä¶ They know exactly what to do in India. Ashwin is a damn fine bowler, doesn‚Äôt matter where he bowls. I‚Äôve seen him bowl in Australia, he bowled extremely well. He is also very smart. He works out exactly what he‚Äôs gotta do. Jadeja doesn‚Äôt vary too much although he has learned a few things and has improved his bowling but he‚Äôs got the skillset that is perfect for India and the two of them work together,‚Äù Chappell told ESPNCricinfo.

headlines: Neliima Azeem recalls when a three-and-a-half year old Ishaan confronted a man who was being ‚Äòaggressive‚Äô with her: ‚ÄòHe said should I call the police?‚Äô
description: Neliima Azeem recalled the time when her kids, Shahid Kapoor and Ishaan Khatter, were really young but were very protective of their mother.
content:
Neliima Azeem, who is the mother of actors Shahid Kapoor and Ishaan Khatter, brought up her sons almost single-handedly and the actor-dancer is very proud of the way her kids have grown up to be confident and responsible adults. Both Shahid and Ishaan were very protective of their mother from a very young age and in a recent chat, Neliima shared an anecdote when a six-year old Shahid confronted a French man who was following his mother.
In a chat with Rashmi Uchil for the book Raising Stars, Neliima recalled the time when she was performing in Belgium. ‚ÄúI was performing in Belgium once and a French guy kept following me around. Shahid was all of six then. He stood up to that guy and told him, ‚ÄòBefore you talk to her, you will have to deal with me. That‚Äôs my mother,'‚Äù she shared.
Neliima recalled another ‚Äúaggressive‚Äù incident which was rather ‚Äúunpleasant‚Äù for her and even Ishaan, who was only three-and-a-half years old at the time, had the presence of mind to threaten the person by telling them that he would call the police. She recalled, ‚ÄúIshaan was equally astute. He was only 3 and a half years old when a rather unpleasant incident took place. He told the person who was getting aggressive with me, ‚ÄòI am watching you. Should I call the police?‚Äô Both my boys have been protective of me since a very early age.‚Äù
ADVERTISEMENT
ALSO READ | Bobby Deol‚Äôs character in Animal is a Muslim because ‚Äòwe see people convert to Islam, but nobody converts to Hinduism‚Äô: Sandeep Reddy Vanga
Neliima Azeem said that she did not have the option to be a stay-at-home mom as she was a single mother and had to earn while raising her boys. ‚ÄúIt is a matter of privilege if you can choose not to work after having kids. I never had the option of not working,‚Äù she said and added that she was ‚Äúthe breadwinner of the family mostly.‚Äù She shared, ‚ÄúBoys who are raised by working mothers generally tend to become more responsible, sensitive, and emotionally caring. They want to help out and ease the financial burden on their mother‚Äôs shoulders.‚Äù
In the past, Shahid Kapoor and Ishaan Khatter have opened up about being raised by a single mother and how it changed their outlook towards life.

headlines: Aiden Markram expresses captaincy ambitions in IPL
description: "What's going to happen, to be honest‚Ä¶ either way we back the management's decision about who they want to be in charge," Markram said.
content:
One of the front-runners for Sunrisers Hyderabad‚Äôs captaincy in IPL-16, South African batter Aiden Markram is ready to take up the challenge if given a chance.
Besides Markram, seasoned opener Mayank Agarwal and veteran India pacer Bhuvneshwar Kumar are the other candidates in fray for the top job in the SRH franchise.
The 28-year-old Markram staked his claim by leading Sunrisers Eastern Cape into the final of the inaugural SA20 with a match-winning century in the last-four clash against Johannesburg Super Kings in Centurion on Thursday.
Mayank endured an unsuccessful stint as Punjab Kings captain before getting the boot. On the other hand, Markram has shown his leadership qualities by successfully leading the IPL franchise‚Äôs South African outfit.
Asked if he is open to leading the side in the high-profile Indian Premier League, Markram responded in the affirmative.
‚ÄúWhat‚Äôs going to happen, to be honest‚Ä¶ either way we back the management‚Äôs decision about who they want to be in charge,‚Äù Markram said.
‚ÄúBecoming the captain is not the be all and end all. You can be in some form of leadership role too. But I am okay with captaincy, it‚Äôs something that I enjoy doing,‚Äù he said ahead of the SA20 final against Pretoria Capitals.
ADVERTISEMENT
‚ÄúI have been captaining for a while before this tournament started. It‚Äôs been a nice experience, a fresh start, I would say,‚Äù he added.
Mayank, who hit a double hundred in the ongoing Ranji Trophy semifinal against Saurashtra, has also brightened his chances of being named captain for the upcoming season of the T20 league.
Bhuvneshwar, 34, is SRH‚Äôs designated vice-captain and had led the side in former skipper Kane Williamson‚Äôs absence previously.
As far as Markram is concerned, the South African scored 381 runs in 14 matches at a strike rate of 139.5 last season. The only thing that could work against him is the lack of experience in leading a team in the IPL.
ADVERTISEMENT
While Markram is entering the final on the back of a brilliant century, his opposite number, Wayne Parnell of Pretoria Capitals, has doubts over his participation in the title clash owing to a groin strain.
Both captains ‚Äî Markram and Parnell ‚Äî believed the quality of cricket in the first-ever SA20 league has been high and it has brought a breath of fresh air into South African cricket after a difficult period.

headlines: India‚Äôs Next Billion-Dollar Startup? Meet Chaitanya Laxman‚Äôs Laxcorp
description: Chaitanya Laxman, a 25-year-old accomplished serial entrepreneur today unveiled his most ambitious venture yet, Laxcorp.
content:
Chaitanya Laxman, a 25-year-old accomplished serial entrepreneur today unveiled his most ambitious venture yet, Laxcorp. Headquartered at WeWork Prestige Atlanta, Koramangala, Bangalore, Laxcorp is an AI company with a bold mission to ethically progress technology for empowerment and positive impact across industries.
‚ÄúWe are thrilled to officially launch Laxcorp and introduce our vision to proactively shape an inclusive, progressive future with responsible AI solutions. Our incredibly talented team gives us an invaluable foundation to maximise our contributions to society,‚Äù said Chaitanya.
The Driven Founder
Chaitanya brings years of expertise in founding startups, building enterprise products and leading engineering teams. At B2B SaaS provider TechLabs, Laxman pioneered innovations in learning management systems and enterprise integration, building it into a leader in its category. After a successful exit of a whopping ‚Çπ30.6Cr from TechLabs, Chaitanya stayed at LeadSquared, a billion-dollar SaaS company, to head its US Cloud initiatives. This record of consistently identifying emerging needs, developing category-defining products, and leading engineering teams put Chaitanya in the top tier of startup founders and technologists nationwide.
ADVERTISEMENT
Now, he is channelling his expertise towards artificial intelligence, assembling a world-class team to build Laxcorp as innovators at the intersection of AI and SaaS. Building an All-Star Team
At Laxcorp, he has assembled a world-class team of AI PhDs, veteran product experts, and engineering leaders to match its bold vision of developing transformative AI for good. While small in size, the team packs a powerful punch when it comes to building innovative high-velocity products.
Heading up software engineering is Adittya, a veteran who honed his talents at RailYatri, Quincus and PlanSource, where he architected infrastructure supporting millions of users. Other team members include Indrajith, Sathwik who are ex-Gojek, and Goldman Sachs.
Leading Laxcorp‚Äôs elite team of data scientists is Narendra Babu, a Ph.D. from IIIT Hyderabad with an extensive academic background developing cutting-edge machine learning algorithms. Narendra is serving as a Chief Data Scientist at Laxcorp to build innovative AI solutions. ‚ÄúOur engineering team intimately understands how to construct secure systems that intelligently leverage data at a massive scale. Their backend expertise wonderfully complements our data science team,‚Äù explained Chaitanya. 
ADVERTISEMENT
Rounding out Laxcorp‚Äôs all-star team are product/UX expert Krishna Sil and product developer Vishal Soni. Sil previously collaborated with Chaitanya at TechLabs, managing design and product requirements that resulted in highly intuitive, user-centric interfaces. His deep understanding of customer needs will ensure that Laxcorp‚Äôs solutions are accessible to all. Vishal is a gifted developer experienced at rapidly bringing concepts to life as polished web applications. Together Krishna and Vishal instil Laxcorp‚Äôs offerings with human-centric design and seamless functionality.
Together, these engineering leaders bring over 30 years of collective experience in designing, building, and operating complex platforms at a massive scale. Their technical expertise will ensure that Laxcorp‚Äôs AI solutions can make the biggest real-world impact with velocity and reliability.
Chaitanya believes the team itself is Laxcorp‚Äôs secret weapon. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôve fostered an environment where exceptional individuals can invent freely. Their creativity is already generating groundbreaking innovations,‚Äù he added. Innovative Products Tackling Pressing Needs 
ADVERTISEMENT
Laxcorp is primed to deliver AI solutions that redefine what‚Äôs possible through products tackling four pressing needs:
Node0 helps developers overcome the challenge of securing applications by providing an intuitive API platform to easily integrate protections.
Nexus modernizes outdated recruitment practices by optimizing how companies evaluate and match candidates based on potential, not just credentials.
CiaraAI alleviates difficulties resolving issues in complex enterprise environments via natural language conversations and contextual responses.
TensorLearn tackles the growing tech skills gap by making hands-on education in emerging fields accessible.
The Time is Now for AI Innovation
When asked about the impetus behind launching now, Chaitanya explained: ‚ÄúThere couldn‚Äôt have been a better time to innovate in the AI space. Every day we are seeing AI models becoming more and more efficient. Tech entrepreneurs around the globe are starting to build solid use cases around that technology. It‚Äôs exactly like what happened in the 90s when the internet, web browsing, and website indexing capabilities of search engines gave birth to companies like Google, and Amazon. The so-called ‚Äú.com bubble‚Äù. Only this time it‚Äôs not a bubble. AI is here to stay and will change the very fundamentals of how software solves a problem. A lot of Enterprises are very appreciative of the cost-cutting capabilities (laughs) of AI and automation. For instance, the higher the number of support inquiries that can be fully automated by CiaraAI, the greater the cost reduction.‚Äù Studies show AI can automate 50-70% of routine support contacts. Enterprises with large, complex, and costly human support teams have greater room for efficiencies and cost savings. The deeper CiaraAI is integrated into the software systems, the more issues can be automated end-to-end. So, it‚Äôs safe to say that for a large enterprise, we estimate CiaraAI could likely reduce total customer support costs by 40-60%.‚Äù
Prioritising Product-Market Fit and Capitalising on Traction
When asked about fundraising plans, Chaitanya clarified: ‚ÄúWe are not particularly worried about the investments as of now. We have enough capital to launch our products and already working with a bunch of pilot customers, as we speak. I personally believe in showing value in terms of traction, basically product market fit. Once PMF is sorted, it‚Äôs easier for a founder to bargain valuations on his terms, Investors are not going anywhere‚Äù.
He continued, ‚ÄúOur products prove AI, when developed thoughtfully, can massively benefit people, and enterprises ‚Äì not just corporate profits. We passionately believe technology should serve humanity‚Äôs needs.‚Äù
ADVERTISEMENT
This ethos permeates Laxcorp‚Äôs human-centric design philosophy and company values like diversity, transparency, sustainability, and excellence. Laxcorp welcomes partners, investors, and talent globally who are passionate about advancing AI to shape an inclusive, progressive digital future.

headlines: India‚Äôs 3 men DRS Plan against Australia: KS Bharat explains why skipper Rohit Sharma refers to him as the ‚Äòbest judge‚Äô
description: In Delhi Test's second innings, KS Bharat scored 23 not out on a tricky surface at a brisk pace to see India home.
content:
Opting for Decision Review System (DRS) ain‚Äôt that straightforward. For India however, there is a clear cut strategy laid out.
Ahead of the third India-Australia Test, Indian wicket-keeper batter KS Bharat has shared that captain Rohit Sharma backed him on taking calls for DRS, terming him as ‚Äòthe best judge‚Äô for close calls and that he shouldn‚Äôt ‚Äòworry about whether it is going to go our way or their way‚Äô.

headlines: AR Rahman and Mani Ratnam: Bringing out the best in each other since 1992
description: AR Rahman and Mani Ratnam have bestowed Indian cinema with some of the greatest tracks with extraordinary visuals. The two have mutually enhanced each other's brilliance, extracting the best from their collaboration.
content:
An ever-romantic Aravind Swamy singing his heart out for his love; a charismatic Mohanlal and Aishwarya Rai dancing in the rain, exposing the government‚Äôs inefficiency; a heartthrob Shah Rukh Khan grooving atop a moving train, rendering one of the most influential Hindi songs ever; a charming Madhavan and Shalini setting couple goals; a devoted father and mother expressing love for their daughter, enumerating her significance to them; a mesmerising Aishwarya Rai savouring the rains in the lush green landscapes of rural India; a Raavan realising the true glory of Sita; a modern couple reflects on love in today‚Äôs context while traversing familiar surroundings; and a track mapping the thoughts of a Chola commander.
These are just a few songs that AR Rahman and Mani Ratnam have created in the past 32 years since the two began joining forces. This list doesn‚Äôt even have one song each from all their movies, let alone their entire discography. Yet, just the aforementioned songs show that the impact of music composer AR Rahman, celebrating his 56th birthday this Saturday, and filmmaker Mani Ratnam on Indian cinema is unparalleled. They have bestowed the visual art with some of the greatest tracks with extraordinary visuals, mutually enhancing each other‚Äôs brilliance, extracting the best from their collaboration, and ensuring the enduring timelessness of their songs and movies.

headlines: Suryakumar Yadav continues to lead ICC T20 batting chart, Shubman Gill achieves career-best position
description: Gill achieved a career-best position after smashing a match-winning century against New Zealand in the third and final ODI in Ahmedabad recently.
content:
India‚Äôs Suryakumar Yadav remained static at the top spot, while compatriot Shubman Gill shot up to a career-best 30th position in the batting chart of the ICC Men‚Äôs T20I Player Rankings released on Wednesday.
Surya continues to lead the batting list with 906 rating points.
Gill achieved a career-best position after smashing a match-winning century against New Zealand in the third and final ODI in Ahmedabad recently.
Gill‚Äôs 126 not out off 63 balls that contributed to India‚Äôs huge 168-run victory and helped the home team seal the series 2-1, lifted him an incredible 168 slots.
The 23-year-old, who has now slammed centuries in all three formats of the game, is ranked sixth in ODIs and 62nd in Tests.
Besides, Virat Kohli has dropped a rung to the 15 position among batters, while K L Rahul slid two places (27th) and skipper Rohit Sharma was further behind in the 29th spot.
Young left-handed wicket-keeper batter Ishan Kishan has also dropped three places to 48th.
No Indian bowler, however, features in the top 10 T20 bowlers list.
ADVERTISEMENT
But left-arm pacer Arshdeep Singh moved eight slots to reach a career-best 13th position after finishing with two for 16 in Ahmedabad.
Bhuvneshwar Kumar dropped a place to 21st, while Ravichandran Ashwin and Axar Patel are static at 29th and 30th spots respectively.
All-rounder Hardik Pandya, who grabbed four for 16 and smashed a 17-ball 30, has progressed in all three lists.
He has moved up from 53rd to 50th among batters, 66th to 46th among bowlers and is in second place among all-rounders, only a couple of rating points behind Bangladesh‚Äôs Shakib Al Hassan.
ADVERTISEMENT
Daryl Mitchell has gained four spots and is in joint-25th position in the latest weekly update that considers performance in the Ahmedabad match for T20Is and the final match of the South Africa-England series for the ODI rankings.
England captain Jos Buttler‚Äôs match-winning 131 in Kimberley has helped him progress six places to 20th position while South Africa fast bowler Lungi Ngidi has advanced five places to reach 19th position after finishing with four for 62 in the high-scoring match.
Dawid Malan (up 31 places to 58th among batters) and fast bowler Jofra Archer (up 13 places to 22nd among bowlers) are other England players to move up in the ODI rankings.
South Africa‚Äôs Heinrich Klaasen is up 11 places to 42nd among batters.

headlines: Need for World Bank‚Äôs governance indicators to be transparent: CEA
description: The World Bank‚Äôs Worldwide Governance Indicators provide a ranking of 215 countries territories based on six dimensions of governance: ‚ÄòVoice and Accountability‚Äô; ‚ÄòPolitical Stability and Absence of Violence‚Äô; ‚ÄòGovernment Effectiveness‚Äô; ‚ÄòRegulatory Quality‚Äô; ‚ÄòRule of Law‚Äô and ‚ÄòControl of Corruption.‚Äô
content:
Raising concerns over the use of World Bank‚Äôs Worldwide Governance Indicators in ratings assessment by credit ratings agencies, especially for emerging economies, Chief Economic Adviser V Anantha Nageswaran on Wednesday said there is a need for the World Governance Index to be more transparent and less subjective.
‚ÄúThe World Bank‚Ä¶.has something called the World Governance Index, which unfortunately or fortunately plays a very significant part in opaque and non-transparent ways in the credit rating assessment deployed by the three credit rating agencies in assigning letter-grades to credit rating of member countries, particularly emerging markets. This World Governance Index itself is a composite of several sub-indices, which are purely based on the subjective opinions of some so-called expert institutions which do not have presence on the ground nor do they understand whether the context in which they are making these judgements is appropriate or apt for the member countries. But these indices become an important part of the assessment methodology of the credit rating agencies and they do not reveal the extent to which these indices are implanted in their assessment process, the weights they carry, because there seems to be qualitative overlays on top of qualitative assessments,‚Äù Nageswaran said at a seminar on ‚ÄòMultilateral Institutions for the 21st Century‚Äô organised by the Department of Economic Affairs, Ministry of Finance.

headlines: Inside Kartik Aaryan‚Äôs birthday bash: Tara Sutaria poses with the birthday boy, Karan Johar, Kriti Sanon arrive in style
description: Kartik Aaryan rang in his 33rd birthday in style with a bash that saw Karan Johar, Tara Sutaria and Kriti Sanon in attendance.
content:
Kartik Aaryan hosted a party to celebrate his 33rd birthday on November 22. Karan Johar, Kriti Sanon, Tara Sutaria, Raveena Tandon and her daughter Rasha Thadani, Vaani Kapoor, Anees Bazmee, Abhishek Kapoor, Pooja Hegde, Huma Qureshi, and others made a stylish outing for Kartik‚Äôs special day. Kartik Aaryan was seen dressed in all-black attire and flaunted his clean-shaven look.
Kartik Aaryan‚Äôs mom, dad, and sister were seen arriving for the party soon after the birthday boy Kartik Aaryan‚Äôs entry.

headlines: Former state-level Punjab hockey player lifts sacks to make a living, gets Rs 1.25 per sack
description: Kumar, who was part of Sports Authority of India, PEPSU and Punjab teams and won medals in four junior hockey nationals and was also named in the Indian junior hockey team in 2007.
content:
He stands out like a sore thumb, as for some inexplicable reason this promising player appears to have got the rough end of the (hockey) stick.
On Sunday evening when 30-year-old Paramjeet Kumar returned after a day-long shift as a ‚Äòpalledar‚Äô (one who loads and unloads rice and wheat 50 kg sacks from trucks) at the Faridkot mandi, the hockey player took some medicines for his fever and spent some time with his five-year-old son Vikrant Kumar.

headlines: India to flag concerns over EU‚Äôs carbon tax, deforestation regulation in WTO meet next year
description: India will address concerns on EU's climate regulations, including carbon tax and deforestation rules, during the WTO ministerial meet, seeking resolution for domestic industries
content:
Developing countries like India will flag serious concerns over the impact of European Union‚Äôs (EU) regulations on climate change and trade such as carbon tax, on their domestic industry, during WTO ministerial meeting next year, an official said.
The four-day 13th ministerial conference (MC) of the World Trade Organization (WTO) is scheduled for February 26 next year in Abu Dhabi. MC is the highest decision making body of WTO.
‚ÄúThese issues will come up in the WTO in a big way. Countries like India will oppose these measures in the WTO,‚Äù the official said.
ADVERTISEMENT
In the first seven months of this year, the EU has introduced four regulations on climate change and trade. These are carbon border adjustment mechanism (CBAM); deforestation regulation; including shipping in the EU‚Äôs emissions trade system; and Foreign subsidies regulation. EU member Germany too has announced a supply chain due diligence act (SCDDA).
‚ÄúThis will become a major issue in the MC13. Many member countries have already submitted papers against some of these regulations in the WTO. It looks like discussions will happen on these regulations and a general view will also converge,‚Äù the government official, who did not wish to be named, said.
Geneva-based 164 member multi-lateral body WTO deals with global exports and import-related norms. Besides, it adjudicates trade disputes between the member countries.
According to think tank Global Trade Research Initiative (GTRI), the EU will collect billions annually once these provisions come into operation completely. They need these funds to provide subsidies to their companies and farmers.
ADVERTISEMENT
The carbon border adjustment mechanism (CBAM) will have an adverse impact on India‚Äôs exports of metals such as iron, steel and aluminium products to the EU. It will come into force from October 1 this year. CBAM will translate into a 20-35 per cent tax on select imports into the EU starting January 1, 2026.
From January 1, 2026, the EU will start collecting the carbon tax on each consignment of steel, aluminium, cement, fertilizer, hydrogen and electricity.
In 2022, India‚Äôs 27 per cent exports of iron, steel, and aluminium products of value USD 8.2 billion went to the EU.
ADVERTISEMENT
Further, India‚Äôs exports of products like coffee, leather hides and paperboard worth USD 1.3 billion annually to the EU will get impacted due to European Union Deforestation-Free Products Regulation (EU-DR).
The regulation covers cattle, buffalo, the meat of bovine animals, preparations, oil cake, soya beans, palm oil, cocoa bean, powder, chocolate, coffee, leather hide, skin, paper, paperboard, wood, wood articles, wood pulp, boards and wood furniture.
The exporters now have to ensure that these products have been grown on land, which has not been deforested after December 31, 2020.
The new rules will apply to large firms after 18 months and small firms after 24 months. Thus, the timeline for large firms is December 2024 and for small firms is June 2025.
As the EU parliament has included shipping in its emissions trade system on April 18 this year, it will charge a carbon tax like levy from EU‚Äôs inbound and outbound shipping firms from January 1, 2027.
ADVERTISEMENT
Similarly, under the Foreign subsidies regulation, which came into force on January 12 this year, the EU can investigate cases where foreign subsidies distort competition within the region.
The German law to prohibit forced labour and protect human rights in global business supply chains will have little impact on India‚Äôs trade with the European country as India already has comprehensive rules to deal with these issues, according to a report by GTRI.
ADVERTISEMENT
Germany has banned forced labour and other labour law violations in its supply chains extending within and outside Germany. The law, SCDDA, came into effect from January 1 this year.
It applies to firms with more than 3,000 employees. These include German firms and foreign firms doing business with Germany.
ADVERTISEMENT
India is already engaging bilaterally with the European Union on these issues.
India‚Äôs exports to the EU has increased to USD 74.9 billion in 2022-23 from about USD 65 billion in 2021-22. The EU accounts for over 16 per cent of India‚Äôs total merchandise exports. Imports from the EU rose to about USD 60 billion in 2022-23 as against USD 51.4 billion in 2021-22.

headlines: Priyanka Chopra poses with Orlando Bloom, enjoys F1 Abu Dhabi GP with Naomi Campbell. Watch
description: Priyanka Chopra attended the Abu Dhabi Grand Prix FI races and was amongst other well-known Hollywood personalities.
content:
Actor Priyanka Chopra Jonas looked chic and stylish at the Abu Dhabi F1 GP. Dressed in a black and pink bodycon dress with a thigh-high slit, the actor made heads turn with her appearance. She also had the company of other well-known Hollywood actors and American fashion icons.
In pictures shared on her fan pages, Priyanka is seen posing with actor Orlando Bloom. In other videos, she is seen enjoying the race with American supermodel Naomi Campbell. She also clicked a group photograph with Chris Hemsworth and Will.i.am. The pictures and videos were shared by a Priyanka Chopra‚Äôs fan page on Instagram.

headlines: How to add or request eSignature on Google Docs
description: The eSignature feature on Google Docs enables users to request eSignatures and monitor the status of pending eSignatures.
content:
In June 2022, Google began alpha testing for the ability to add eSignatures to Google Docs. Presently, this functionality is available for individual subscribers through an open beta in Google Workspace. This makes it convenient to add digital signatures to documents within Google Drive.
The eSignature feature on Google Docs enables users to request eSignatures, monitor the status of pending eSignatures, and even locate completed contracts without needing to switch applications or browser tabs. In the near future, Google also plans to introduce an Audit trail, multi-signer functionality, and the ability to obtain eSignature from individuals who do not use Gmail.

headlines: ‚ÄòMy body has suffered my impatience‚Äô: Antonio Conte to miss Tottenham Hotspur‚Äôs clash with West Ham
description: Conte, whose assistant Cristian Stellini will again take over responsibility for the first team, said he had underestimated the severity of his surgery.
content:
LONDON: Tottenham Hotspur manager Antonio Conte will miss his side‚Äôs Premier League home clash against West Ham United on Sunday as he continues to recover from gallbladder surgery.
Conte has remained in Italy following Tottenham‚Äôs 1-0 defeat by AC Milan in the Champions League on Tuesday.
‚ÄúFollowing a routine post-operation check in Italy yesterday (Wednesday), Antonio Conte will remain at his family home to further and fully recover from his recent gallbladder surgery,‚Äù Tottenham said in a statement.
‚ÄúHealth is the most important consideration and everyone at the club wishes him well.‚Äù
The 53-year-old missed Tottenham‚Äôs 1-0 win over Manchester City 11 days ago after undergoing surgery but had returned to the dugout for last weekend‚Äôs Premier League fixture against Leicester City, in which they were hammered 4-1.
Conte, whose assistant Cristian Stellini will again take over responsibility for the first team, said he had underestimated the severity of his surgery.
‚ÄúMy great sense of responsibility towards the club, the players, the staff and the fans brought me to anticipate my comeback on field,‚Äù he said on Instagram.
ADVERTISEMENT
‚ÄúSadly I underestimated the procedure, which wasn‚Äôt a routine operation, but a sudden and serious emergency.
‚ÄúMy body has suffered my impatience and now I am forced to stop until my entire recovery. Who knows me, understands what a burden this is for me, but it is necessary. Come on you Spurs!‚Äù
Conte‚Äôs contract expires at the end of June with Tottenham having the option to extend it for another year.
Tottenham are fifth in the Premier League.

headlines: Bank of Baroda net profit rises 88% in Q1 on strong NII
description: Domestic advances rose nearly 17% year-on-year to `8.1 trillion as on June 30.
content:
The net profit of Bank of Baroda rose 88% year-on-year in April-June owing to a growth in its net interest income.
The public sector bank posted a bottomline of `4,070 crore in the quarter under review. The net profit was lower than `4,775 crore in the March quarter.
Net interest income, difference between interest earned and interest expended rose 24.4% year-on-year to `10,997 crore in the quarter under review. The bank‚Äôs net interest margin rose to 3.4% in April-June from 3.07% a year ago.
The net interest income was lifted by a growth in the bank‚Äôs advances.

headlines: Nvidia delays launch of new China-focused AI chip
description: Nvidia is betting on the chips to help it preserve its market share in China after it was barred from shipping products including its advanced A800 and H800 AI chips by Washington's tightened export rules.
content:
Nvidia has told customers in China it is delaying the launch of a new artificial intelligence chip it designed to comply with U.S. export rules until the first quarter of next year, two sources familiar with the matter said.
The delayed chip is the H20, the most powerful of three China-focused chips Nvidia has developed to comply with fresh U.S. export restrictions, the sources said, and could complicate its efforts to preserve market share in China against local rivals like Huawei.
The California-based AI chip giant had been expected to launch the new products as early as Nov. 16, chip industry newsletter SemiAnalysis reported this month.
ADVERTISEMENT
However, the H20 launch has now been pushed back until the first quarter of next year, the sources said, with one saying they were advised it could take place in February or March.
Also Read | X may lose up to $75 mln by year-end on advertiser exodus
Both sources declined to be named as the information was confidential. Nvidia declined to comment.
The sources said they were told that the H20 was being delayed due to issues server manufacturers were having in integrating the chip.
In addition to the H20, Nvidia has been planning two other chips to comply with new U.S. export rules ‚Äì the L20 and L2. The sources said the L20 was not facing delays and would launch according to its original schedule. They were unable to share information on the status of the L2.
ADVERTISEMENT
Nvidia is betting on the chips to help it preserve its market share in China after it was barred from shipping products including its advanced A800 and H800 AI chips by Washington‚Äôs tightened export rules.
Also Read | ChatGPT alternatives fast catching up: Latest Grok, Claude, Bard, Ernie updates prove so
The A800 and H800 were introduced as alternatives for Chinese customers in November 2022, about a month after the U.S. first banned exports of advanced microchips and equipment to China.
The H20, L20 and L2 include most of Nvidia‚Äôs newest features for AI work, but have had some of their computing power measures cut back to comply with new U.S. rules, according to SemiAnalysis‚Äô analysis of the chips‚Äô specifications.
The U.S. export curbs have created an opportunity for rivals such as Huawei to win orders that may have otherwise gone to Nvidia, whose graphics processing units (GPUs) dominate the AI market.
ADVERTISEMENT
Chinese internet giant Baidu placed a sizeable order for Huawei AI chips this year, Reuters reported this month citing sources. One source said Baidu had done so before the U.S. curbs were announced because it was preparing for a future when it would no longer be able to purchase from Nvidia.

headlines: GST collections at Rs 1.72 lakh crore in October, second highest-ever
description: "GST revenue collection for October 2023 is second highest ever, next only to April 2023, at Rs 1.72 lakh crore; records increase of 13 per cent Y-o-Y," the Finance Minstry said in a statement.
content:
GST collections in October stood at Rs 1.72 lakh crore, the second highest-ever, the finance ministry said on Wednesday.
The collections are 13 per cent higher than the Rs 1.52 lakh crore collected in October 2022.
‚ÄúGST revenue collection for October 2023 is second highest ever, next only to April 2023, at Rs 1.72 lakh crore; records increase of 13 per cent Y-o-Y,‚Äù the ministry said in a statement.
ADVERTISEMENT
The highest-ever revenue from Goods and Services Tax (GST) was recorded in April 2023 at Rs 1.87 lakh crore.
The average gross monthly GST collection in the FY 2023-24 now stands at Rs 1.66 lakh crore, 11 per cent higher than the year-ago period.

headlines: Salaar director Prashanth Neel says he ‚Äòcourted‚Äô Prabhas for four months; reveals striking resemblance between ‚ÄòRebel Star‚Äô, KGF‚Äôs Yash
description: Likening working with an actor to going on a date and getting married, Salaar director Prashanth Neel recently said that he "courted Prabhas for four months".
content:
After the epic Barbenheimer battle, where Greta Gerwig‚Äôs Barbie and Christopher Nolan‚Äôs Oppenheimer engaged in an ultimate showdown at the box office in July, the world of cinema is set to witness another high-octane war between two of the most anticipated Indian films of 2023 ‚Äî Rajkumar Hirani‚Äôs Shah Rukh Khan-starrer Dunki and Prashanth Neel‚Äôs Prabhas-starrer Salaar Part 1 ‚Äì Ceasefire.
Amidst substantial anticipation for these films, advance bookings for Dunki and Salaar have already begun and the two films have so far recorded Rs 4.46 crore and Rs 3.58 crore, respectively, as reported by industry tracker Sacnilk. While Dunki is a comedy-drama, Salaar is touted as an epic action thriller, marking the return of ‚ÄúRebel Star‚Äù Prabhas to the realm of mass actioners.

headlines: ‚ÄòAI‚Äô is Collins Dictionary Word of the year 2023
description: The Collins Dictionary has chosen AI, or artificial intelligence, as its Word of the Year 2023. Here are some of the others that made it to the shortlist.
content:
A few years back, if you mentioned the acronym ‚ÄúAI‚Äù in common parlance, you would have had to be explaining that you are referring to artificial intelligence. Fast forward to 2023 and that is far from the case. You speak about AI and you will enter a conversation with someone who is a little scared about losing their job to a machine. And perhaps that is why the Collins dictionary chose ‚ÄúAI‚Äù as its word of the year for 2023.
The dictionary describes AI as ‚Äúthe modelling of human mental functions by computer programs.‚Äù It is perhaps only natural that AI was the word selected this year. Ever since ChatGPT was launched in November 2022, online searches for AI have surged. The AI market is projected to grow by nearly 800 per cent to around $1.8 trillion, according to the World Economic Forum.

headlines: Merry Christmas box office collection day 5: Sriram Raghavan‚Äôs slow burning thriller earns Rs 12.53 crore in five days, performs better in South India
description: Merry Christmas box office collection day 5: The Katrina Kaif- Vijay Sethupathi starrer earned Rs 1.15 crore nett, on Tuesday, in India in Hindi and Tamil languages.
content:
Katrina Kaif and Vijay Sethupathi-starrer Merry Christmas has turned out to be a slow earner. Even after very positive review by film critics and a positive word-of-mouth by the audience, the Sriram Raghavan directorial has been earning in single digits with lowest box office collection on Tuesday. According to industry tracking website Sacnilk, on day five of its release (Tuesday, January 16), the film minted Rs 1.15 crore nett in India in all languages. The total domestic collection of Merry Christmas stands at Rs 12.53 crore.
At the worldwide box office, the movie has managed to mint Rs 16 crore where Rs 2.5 crore are retained from overseas market while Rs 13.5 crore gross can be attributed to its domestic box office collection.
On Tuesday, the film witnessed a 10.25% Hindi occupancy. In Mumbai it has 342 shows running in cinemas with 10.75 percent occupancy, whereas in Delhi and NCR region there were 479 shows with 9.50 percent occupancy. The Vijay Sethupathi starrer is performing well in South Indian states. The film witnessed 26.04 percent Tamil occupancy even when very few shows of the film are running in cinemas. Chennai had only 61 shows running with 34.25 percent occupancy, Bangaluru with 14  shows had 15.75 occupancy and Kochi with the least number of shows (11) had an occupancy of 37.00 percent.
With no other major Hindi films running in cinemas, Merry Christmas will enjoy a free run in theatres until Pankaj Tripathi‚Äôs Main Atal Hoon releases on January 19 and Deepika Padukone and Hrithik Roshan‚Äôs Fighter, directed by Pathaan director Siddharth Anand will release on January 25. However, in South Indian states the film is facing a steep competition from films like HanuMan, which is performing extremely well in cinemas with it already earning Rs 100 crore internationally. Other films performing well in the south are Dhanush‚Äôs Captain Miller, Sivakarthikeyan‚Äôs Ayalaan, Mahesh Babu‚Äôs Guntur Kaaram, Venkatesh Daggubati‚Äôs Saindhav and Nagarjuna‚Äôs Naa Saami Ranga.
        Click for more updates and latest Bollywood news along with Entertainment updates. Also get latest news and top headlines from India and around the world at The Indian Express.

headlines: Fans questioned by police over Russian flags at Australian Open
description: Tennis Australia did not provide details, but a video emerged on social media showing a fan on the steps of Rod Laver Arena holding up a Russian flag with the image of President Vladimir Putin on it.
content:
Four supporters at the Australian Open with ‚Äúinappropriate flags and symbols‚Äù are being questioned by Victoria Police following the quarter-final between Russia‚Äôs Andrey Rublev and favourite Novak Djokovic, organisers Tennis Australia said on Wednesday.
Just took a walk around Melbourne Park after filing and a group of people were standing on the Rod Laver Arena steps, holding up a flag with Vladimir Putin‚Äôs face and chanting in support of Russia. pic.twitter.com/2p0LfkyVC3
‚Äî Tumaini Carayol (@tumcarayol) January 25, 2023
Tennis Australia did not provide details, but a video emerged on social media showing a fan on the steps of Rod Laver Arena holding up a Russian flag with the image of President Vladimir Putin on it.
Russian and Belarusian flags are banned from Melbourne Park during the Australian Open after a complaint from the Ukraine ambassador to the country last week. Belarus is a key staging ground for Russia‚Äôs war in Ukraine, which Moscow terms a ‚Äúspecial operation‚Äù.
‚ÄúFour people in the crowd leaving the stadium revealed inappropriate flags and symbols and threatened security guards. Victoria Police intervened and are continuing to question them,‚Äù Tennis Australia said in a statement.
‚ÄúThe comfort and safety of everyone is our priority and we work closely with security and authorities.‚Äù
Photos on social media also showed one fan in the crowd during the quarter-final with a large ‚ÄúZ‚Äù on his shirt.
–¢—Ä–∏–∫–æ–ª–æ—Ä, –ü—É—Ç—ñ–Ω —ñ —Å–∏–º–≤–æ–ª Z. –ù–∞ —Ç—Ä–∏–±—É–Ω–∞—Ö —Ç–∞ –±—ñ–ª—è –∞—Ä–µ–Ω–∏ Australian Open –∑–Ω–æ–≤—É —Ä–∞—à–∏—Å—Ç—Å—å–∫—ñ —Å–∏–º–≤–æ–ª–∏ üò°üò°üò°
–•–æ—á–∞ —ó—Ö –∑–∞–±–æ—Ä–æ–Ω–∏–ª–∏ —â–µ –ø—ñ—Å–ª—è –ø–µ—Ä—à–æ–≥–æ —ñ–Ω—Ü–∏–¥–µ–Ω—Ç—É.#russiaisateroriststate pic.twitter.com/yKE1AwjgrS
‚Äî Tribuna.com –£–∫—Ä–∞—ó–Ω–∞ (@tribunaua) January 25, 2023
Russian forces have used the letter ‚ÄúZ‚Äù as an identifying symbol on their vehicles in Ukraine following the invasion. Some supporters of the invasion have also used the sign.
Ukraine‚Äôs Former player Alexandr Dolgopolov urged Tennis Australia to issue a life ban for the individual in a tweet.
üëÄ And just like that ‚Ä¶ we believe this is the 1st display of the Z symbol of Russia‚Äôs war on Ukraine at the international tennis tournament.
ü§î Looks like he was hiding it under the white t-shirt huh? pic.twitter.com/iG6Z0wtdkq
‚Äî Ukrainian Tennis ‚Ä¢ BTU (@ukrtennis_eng) January 25, 2023
Vasyl Myroshnychenko, Ukraine‚Äôs ambassador to Australia and New Zealand, posted a picture last week showing a Russian flag hanging from a bush beside a court where his compatriot Kateryna Baindl was playing her first-round match.
Tennis Australia responded by immediately banning the flags of Russia and Belarus. Russian and Belarusian players were banned from Wimbledon last year but are able to compete as individual athletes without national affiliation at the Australian Open.
ADVERTISEMENT
Their flags are not displayed beside their names in TV broadcasts, as is the case for other players, and their nation is not indicated on draw sheets.

headlines: Faced with boycotts and IOC pressure, IBA says Delhi World Boxing Championships will be Paris 2024 qualifier
description: Late on Monday, an IOC spokesperson told The Indian Express that the "only valid boxing qualification system for Paris 2024 is the one approved by IOC" and reiterated that IBA's suspension was still in place.
content:
Mumbai: Faced with boycott calls from national boxing federations of as many as eight countries, the International Boxing Association (IBA) has doubled down and designated the upcoming Women‚Äôs World Boxing Championships in New Delhi as the ‚Äúmain qualification event‚Äù for next year‚Äôs Paris Olympics along with the Men‚Äôs World Boxing Championships, to be held in Tashkent in May.
In the last 24 hours, the national boxing federations of the Netherlands and Switzerland had announced they were joining the list of nations to not send their boxers to the World Championships, which will be held from March 15 to 26 at New Delhi‚Äôs IG Sports Complex.
USA, Ireland, Great Britain, Canada, Sweden and Czech Republic had also threatened to boycott the event over the inclusion of Russian and Belarussian boxers, who have been allowed to compete under their flag and national anthems.
The move by the beleaguered IBA to announce its own Olympic Qualification System (OQS) for Paris 2024 was dismissed by the IOC. It had barred the IBA from organising the boxing event at the upcoming Olympics in Paris. The IOC had unequivocally said that it would be taking over the management of organising a qualification pathway for Paris 2024 as well. In fact, in September last year the IOC‚Äôs EB had approved its Paris 2024 qualification pathway, which would see continental events like the Asian Games being designated as quota events. After the five continental events were done, the IOC was to organise two more global events to offer quotas to boxers for Paris.
IOC reiterates that IBA is suspended
Late on Monday, an IOC spokesperson told The Indian Express, ‚ÄúAs announced by the IOC in June 2022, the IBA will not be involved in Paris 2024‚Äôs boxing qualifications and tournament. The only valid boxing qualification system for Paris 2024 is the one approved by the IOC EB in September 2022. Following an investigation and report by an IOC Inquiry Committee in 2019, recognition of the International Boxing Association was suspended by the IOC. This suspension is still in force today.‚Äù
Despite the IOC‚Äôs clarification, the presence of two so-called qualification pathways is likely to further split an already divided boxing world with one block of nations rallying around USA, Ireland and Great Britain while the other rallying around the IBA.
The IBA said that ‚Äúno other qualification process for Paris 2024 will be accepted by the IBA and the boxing community‚Äù. As per the IBA‚Äôs qualification system, the Women‚Äôs World Boxing Championships, Men‚Äôs World Boxing Championships, and an open event in May 2024 will be the tournaments offering direct quotas to the Paris Olympics.
ADVERTISEMENT
The IBA will also use world and continental ranking quotas besides handing out host country and universality spots.
‚ÄúWith less than 18 months to Paris 2024 and numerous delays on a clear International Olympic Committee (IOC) process being announced for Paris 2024 qualification, the IBA has taken upon itself, as the international governing body of boxing, to provide a clear process and pathway for its athletes to qualify for Paris 2024. The IBA OQS decision was unanimously taken by National Federations at the IBA Ordinary Congress in Abu Dhabi,‚Äù boxing‚Äôs global governing body said in a statement on Monday.
‚ÄúThis is a necessary step to protect our athletes as the IOC proposed qualification process consisting of one competition is not acceptable and fair for the athletes. To exclude World Champions from the upcoming Women‚Äôs and Men‚Äôs World Boxing Championships in New Delhi and Tashkent from qualifying for Paris 2024 is not acceptable and against the principles of sport and boxing,‚Äù it added.
As for the eight national boxing federations to have announced boycotts of the Worlds in New Delhi, the IBA said it would allow boxers to ‚Äúdirectly register‚Äù for the World Boxing Championships by sending an email to them and also promised to provide the boxers with financial aid through its Financial Support Program (FSP).
After widespread corruption among judges and referees at the Rio de Janeiro Olympics boxing event, IOC had snatched away the right to host the boxing event at the deferred Tokyo Olympics from IBA (then known as AIBA).
ADVERTISEMENT
Over the last few months, the IOC has also threatened to drop the sport completely from the Paris 2024 program if the IBA does not clean up its house. The sport did not make it to the initial sports program for the Los Angeles Olympics in 2028, although it can be added later.
Beside corruption at the Rio Olympics, IOC has also been concerned by governance and fairness issues within the IBA. The fact that IBA gets most of its sponsorships funds through the Russian oil company Gazprom is an issue constantly raised by the critics of IBA president Umar Kremlev, who is also Russian.

headlines: These IIT students are mentoring JEE, NEET aspirants for exam preparation through their own YouTube channels
description: JEE Main 2024: The indianexpress.com reached out to some IIT students who while during their studies have started their own YouTube channels and how they are mentoring students on engineering and other entrance exams.
content:
Not just excelling in their academic life, but some IIT students are also using their skills to educate and inspire Joint Entrance Examination (JEE) aspirants. Thanks to their good ranks in JEE Advanced, these students have found followers on social media who ask multiple questions about their preparation plan. Encouraged by this, many IIT students have started building their content on not just engineering exam preparation but also on campus life.
JEE is taken by over a million students every year and only a handful clear it. The indianexpress.com reached out to some IIT students who while during their studies have started their own YouTube channels and are busy mentoring engineering exam aspirants.

headlines: IIT Kanpur sets up new centre of excellence to monitor air quality
description: IIT Kanpur's ATMAN aims to address critical air quality challenges and will focus on building indigenous low-cost sensor manufacturing and AI/ML capabilities to enhance air quality.
content:
The Indian Institute of Technology (IIT) Kanpur has established a new centre of excellence ‚Äî ATMAN (Advanced Technologies for Monitoring Air-quality iNdicators) that will focus on building indigenous low-cost sensor manufacturing and AI/ML capabilities to enhance air quality. 
CoE ATMAN aims to translate sustainable technologies and business models into practical products and services with cutting-edge technology, an IIT Kanpur statement said.

headlines: Katrina Kaif says she had to google Vijay Sethupathi to ‚Äòrefresh her memory‚Äô after he was cast in Merry Christmas: ‚ÄòI loved his salt-and-pepper look‚Äô
description: Katrina Kaif said that she had seen Vijay Sethupathi in 96 but had to google his name to 'refresh her memory'.
content:
Katrina Kaif will soon be seen with Vijay Sethupathi in director Sriram Raghavan‚Äôs Merry Christmas, and in a recent interview, when Katrina was asked about what she thought of Vijay before she met him for the first time, she said that she googled his name to ‚Äúrefresh her memory‚Äù even though she claimed to have watched his film 96. In a chat with Bollywood Hungama, Katrina misremembered the name of 96 and called it ‚ÄòClass of 83‚Äô, which was a different movie starring Bobby Deol.
She said, ‚ÄúI had actually first really noticed in the film class of 83‚Ä¶ Is it class of 83 or 83?‚Äù When Vijay and Sriram both corrected her and reminded her that it was 96, she continued, ‚Äú96, sorry. That‚Äôs a few years off but‚Ä¶ I had actually loved that film 96. It had scenes that even now I remember in my head. The moments between him and Trisha, very unique and very tender, they really stayed with me. So I was familiar with him from that movie.‚Äù

headlines: Manoj Bajpayee recalls Amitabh Bachchan catching him for changing lines in a scene: ‚ÄòWith Amit ji, you can‚Äôt improvise‚Äô
description: Manoj Bajpayee, who has worked several times with Amitabh Bachchan, spoke about how particular the legendary actor is about his lines.
content:
Actor Manoj Bajpayee spoke about the thrills and challenges of improvising on set, but said that no matter what you do as an actor, you must remember to never change a single word while giving Amitabh Bachchan his cues during a shot. Manoj has worked with the legendary actor on several occasions, and said that Amitabh rigorously rehearses his lines in advance. In an interview, Manoj said that he also enjoys rehearsing, because he can improvise only if he knows his lines perfectly.
At the Bollywood Hungama actors roundtable, Manoj spoke about the benefits of rehearsals and recalled an anecdote about Amitabh Bachchan. ‚ÄúAmit ji rehearses quite diligently. I‚Äôve done three or four films with him. You cannot mess with his cues. A couple of times, I improvised slightly. He says, ‚ÄòSuniye, aapne kuch badla hai kya (Listen, have you changed something)?‚Äô I said, ‚ÄòPata nahi sir (I don‚Äôt know)‚Äô.‚Äù

headlines: India‚Äôs crude oil imports ‚Äì Russia, Iraq gain at Saudi Arabia‚Äôs expense in September
description: India‚Äôs oil imports from Riyadh in September were at around 556,185 bpd, down nearly a third from August volumes. Between January 2022 and August 2023, the import volumes averaged at over 750,000 bpd.
content:
After falling in August, India‚Äôs imports of Russian and Iraqi oil recovered in September, most likely due to their price advantage over comparable Saudi Arabian crude grades, even as India‚Äôs overall crude oil imports slumped to their lowest this year as the refinery maintenance shutdown season kicked in, shows an analysis of data from commodity market analytics and intelligence firm Kpler.
India‚Äôs Russian oil imports had fallen to a seven-month low of 1.55 million barrels per day (million bpd) in August.
